metadata.title: CVE-2024-46681 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:pktgen: use cpus_read_lock() in pg_net_init()I have seen the WARN_ON(smp_processor_id() != cpu) firingin pktgen_thread_worker() during tests.We must use cpus_read_lock()/cpus_read_unlock()around the for_each_online_cpu(cpu) loop.While we are at it use WARN_ON_ONCE() to avoid a possible syslog flood.

criterions.comment: linux-fips: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws-fips: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
